Professional Experience
Dark Horse | Quality Assurance Engineer | Internship
2022
  • Transferred the app to be mobile friendly, using media queries with a mobile first approach. This resulted in better UI/UX for the customers which resulted in an increase in App Usage.
  • Fixed security issues in the back end resulting in user data being protected. This includes stronger registration validations. In addition to this I identified other security concerns to the CTO such as infinite number of login attempts being allowed on the platform. As well as users being able to upload large file sizes to the image uploader which resulted in saving the company from getting hit with huge future cost.
  • Performed extensive use of the app, testing it from a user perspective, and reporting findings to the CEO which resulted in an increase of user retention.
Projects
Movie Review Project "Tom Rotten" (Rotten Tomatoes clone) | github
2020 - 2021
  • Movie review app similar to Rotten Tomatoes. Reviews are restricted to 150 characters or less for ease of use for the reader. Tom Rotten was created for people that donâ€™t want to spend hours reading movie reviews.
  • Features of the site include login/registration, creating/deleting reviews, as well as a site wide user rating system.
  • Full stack React application built using RESTful API, originally built in JavaScript and then refactored to TypeScript. Other technologies include Axios, MySQL, Express, Node, and Material UI.
  • Website is secured using JSON Web Tokens (JWT) and stored hashed password in a MySQL database.
  • Website is hosted inside a S3 bucket on AWS along with cloud front and route 53. Tom Rotten Link
  • Functional and styled components are used along with React Hooks for encapsulation and better readability.
Hobby Max (e-commerce store) | github
2021
  • An e-commerce store to showcase personal hobbies.
  • React front end using functional components with state being maintained via hooks.
  • API calls are made to a 3rd party service (stripe) to handle the transaction process.
  • Website is hosted using AWS services inside of an S3 bucket and Route 53. Hobby Max Link
  • Material-UI is used for styling encapsulation for cleaner code.
  • Website has a checkout process with buyers getting a confirmation page upon completion of order.
  • Users can add/modify items from their cart with the simple press of a button.
Pop Quiz (Quiz App) | github
2021
  • Pop quiz that features random questions from pop culture to world history.
  • React front end with TypeScript, Node, and Material-UI.
  • App makes API calls to a 3rd party website that hosts the questions.
  • Pop Quiz is hosted using AWS using an S3 bucket and route 53. Pop Quiz Link
  • State is managed by React Hooks.
